ygData.subject: Re: The ONE thing missing in EQ
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Well, if nothing else, it certainly gives us a reason to have websites ;) Seriously, though, due to the constant upgrading of spells, changing of levels,
ygData.messageBody:
At 06:43 AM 9/27/99 -0500, you wrote:
>From: Jason Rochelle <Jasroc@...>
>
>Ok, Ok, there are several things missing in EQ, but more that anything
>else is this:
>
> A list of spells and what they do.
>
>Am I the only one who noticed and is frustrated by this? Bards seem to
>be affect less by this than other classes, but they are still affected.

Well, if nothing else, it certainly gives us a reason to have websites ;)

Seriously, though, due to the constant upgrading of spells, changing of
levels, effects and names, it's a good thing that Verant never did create a
"spellbook" - it would have been outdated 1 week after it was written.

Then again - perhaps that is the problem?

But at least there ARE numerous very handy websites out there - check the
FAQ for a couple of Bard-related ones, and if you want a pure-spellcaster
site, try Baelish's: http://eq.castersrealm.com/


Talies the Wanderer
Check out the EverQuesting Bard:
http://amtgard.pinkpig.com/bards/eqbard.htm
